adverbs.description: sniffingly (comparative more sniffingly, superlative most sniffingly)

entries.meaning: With a sniffing sound or action.
examples: All during the night the riding ponies had grazed in close proximity to the house, had stamped about it, and occasionally had put their noses to its cracks, sniffingly to satisfy either curiosity or a desire for human companionship.
Philip Hone sniffingly noted in his diary that "they increase our taxes, eat our bread and encumber our streets, and not one in twenty is competent to keep himself."
